content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Iron Plate Smelting Station at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0)
Consists of:
– Furnace (at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0)) used to convert iron ore and coal into iron plates for subsequent crafting operations.

### Copper Plate Smelting Station at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0)
Consists of:
– Furnace (at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0)) that processes copper ore and coal into copper plates to support production of copper cables and other required components.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• API Parameter Usage for get_entities:
  – Avoid supplying unsupported keyword arguments (e.g. “radius”) or positional arguments. Verify the function’s signature and pass only the expected parameters.

• Lab Placement and Crafting Failures:
  – When placing a Lab, ensure the required Lab item is available in inventory.
  – Crafting failures occur when intermediate components (such as iron‐gear‐wheels and electronic circuits) are missing. Confirm that all prerequisite ingredients and their production chains (iron plates, copper plates, copper cables, etc.) are sufficiently supplied before attempting Lab crafting.

• Handling Non‐Iterable Returns:
  – Protect against errors by checking that the return from get_entities is an iterable (or default to an empty list) to avoid “NoneType” iteration issues.

• Resource Shortages:
  – Repeated crafting errors indicate shortages in key ingredients. Prioritize securing or smelting the missing resources before reattempting complex recipes.
